subject: p15272972
Findings: PA and lateral upright chest radiographs were reviewed in comparison to and CT torso from. The patient is after median sternotomy and CABG with stable appearance of heart and mediastinum. Lungs are essentially clear with no pleural effusion or pneumothorax. Elevated right hemidiaphragm is unchanged.
